definitions.definition: a share or a financial involvement in something such as a business:
examples: He holds (= owns) a 40 percent stake in/of the company.

definitions.definition: If you have a stake in something, it is important to you because you have a personal interest or involvement in it:
examples: Employers have a stake in the training of their staff.

definitions.definition: to risk an amount of money:
examples: At the roulette table, he staked $10,000 on number 21.
